TITLE: Taiwan willing to offer help to China to deal with Covid-19 surge

SUMMARY: Dubai has scrapped a 30% tax on alcohol and will no longer charge tourists or expats for permits to buy alcoholic drinks as the emirate tries to attract more foreign workers and visitors in the face of growing regional competition.

SUMMARY: North Korea has fired Pak Jong Chon, the second most powerful military official after leader Kim Jong Un, state media reported.

SUMMARY: Free condoms are now available to young people under the age of 26 at French pharmacies as part of what French President Emmanuel Macron has called "a small revolution in preventative healthcare."

SUMMARY: At least 14 people died in a brazen armed assault on a prison in the Mexican border city of Juarez on Sunday, officials said.

SUMMARY: The year has only just started but already Europe has broken an alarming number of weather records as extreme heat spread across the continent.

SUMMARY: Snooker's governing body on Tuesday said it had suspended two more Chinese players as it investigates an alleged match-fixing and betting scandal -- bringing the number of players from the Asian country caught up in the probe to 10.

TITLE: Israel's rightward shift leaves its new Arab allies in an awkward spot
SUMMARY: It was a rare embrace between one of Israel's most controversial politicians and an Arab ambassador. Itamar Ben Gvir and the United Arab Emirates' Ambassador to Israel Mohamed Al Khaja clutched each other's hands in a warm greeting in Tel Aviv in early December.

TITLE: Iranian authorities release prominent actress Taraneh Alidoosti on bail
SUMMARY: One of Iran's best-known actresses, who was arrested after she criticized the execution of a man involved in nationwide protests, was released on bail on Wednesday, state-aligned ISNA said.

TITLE: Japan is paying families to leave Tokyo. Here's why
SUMMARY: Japan is offering to pay families to move out of its overcrowded capital, in an effort to revitalize countryside towns and boost the falling birth rate.

TITLE: China, Philippines to revive talks over oil exploration in South China Sea
SUMMARY: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and his Philippine counterpart Ferdinand Marcos Jr. have agreed to strengthen economic ties and resume talks on oil exploration, as they look to revive their economies amid the pandemic downturn and friction over contested areas of the South China Sea.

TITLE: United said it had this woman's missing bag. She tracked it to a residential address
SUMMARY: Most of us know the travel fear of a bag not appearing on the belt after a flight. Some of us -- ever more, thanks to the aviation chaos this year -- know the gut punch of it not appearing. But an increasing number of travelers know what it's like to lose a bag and get it back -- not because of airlines' diligence, but because they knew their bag's location thanks to a tracking device they'd packed with their clothes.

SUMMARY: Germany just took a step closer to finding a long-term, greener replacement for Russian natural gas and coal.
